content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Pick the best new idea and actually WRITE the code to implement it as a new PopeBot skill in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). Write and execute a test to prove it works. Use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a progress report detailing what you built, how you implemented it, your test results, and code samples so the user can review it at 8 AM.

content.thinking:
This is an interesting task. I need to:

1. Scan three GitHub repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures
2. Pick the best new idea
3. Implement it as a new PopeBot skill in my sandbox (.pi/skills/)
4. Write and execute a test to prove it works
5. Send an email to winsorllc@yahoo.com with a progress report

Let me start by exploring these repositories. I'll need to clone them or at least examine their structure to understand what tools/skills/architectures they contain.

Let me first check what's already in my environment and then clone these repos to examine them.

content.text: I'll scan these three repositories to discover new tools, skills, and architectures, then implement the best idea as a new PopeBot skill. Let me start by cloning and examining each repository.

arguments.command: mkdir -p /job/tmp/research && cd /job/tmp/research && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw.git zeroclaw 2>&1 | head -20

content.thinking:
<tool_call>
<function=bash>
<parameter=command>
cd /job/tmp/research && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw.git openclaw 2>&1 | head -20
</parameter>
</function>
</tool_call>
